lead_paragraph: Plenette Pierson and Kara Braxton combined for 45 points and 22 rebounds to lead the defending champion Detroit Shock to a 108-100 victory last night against the Phoenix Mercury in Game 1 of the W.N.B.A. finals in Auburn Hills, Mich.Detroit took the lead in the best-of-five series despite the absence of the All-Star Cheryl Ford, who sat out with a knee injury. It was the highest-scoring game in the history of the finals.
